description:
Understanding the fundamentals is absolutely critical when venturing into real estate markets.

This course is designed to ensure a clear understanding of how the market value of real estate is determined.

By taking this course you will learn from George Walsh, a certified general real estate appraiser. He is certified to perform appraisals on all commercial and residential properties. He has worked as a Forensic Appraiser, General Appraiser, Commercial Appraiser and Residential Appraiser throughout the New York area. All of that experience is combined with 25+ years in the real estate industry as a buyer, seller, investor, renovator, educator, appraiser and consultant. Currently, George is appraising in New York and teaching as an adjunct professor at Stephen L. Newman Real Estate Institute at CUNY Baruch College.

In this course he describes the tools, techniques and process to value real estate. By the end of the presentations you will be able to:

  • Identify the market value of a residential home
  • Identify the market value of an income producing property
  • Understand the purpose of an appraisal
  • Increase your real estate transaction literacy
  • Determine the fundamental building blocks of real estate value
  • Understand Highest and Best Use principles
  • Understand the formulas which determine the value of an income producing property
title: Real Estate Fundamentals: The Valuation Process
